The percentage of the population aged 65: According to 2019 Census Bureau data, 20.5% of West Virginia's population is made up of people at least 65 years old, ranking it third highest among all states.
Median age of the population: Census data for 2018 shows that West Virginia's median age was 42.7 years, ranking it fourth highest in the country.
Comparison to other states: West Virginia is among the states with the highest population of people aged at least 65, and it has the fourth-oldest median age in the country. However, it is not the oldest state by these measures.
Historical data: Two decades ago, West Virginia did rank first in the country in terms of median age, but it is no longer the oldest state based on current data.
